subject: Critical Thinking
title: The Halo Effect: One Trait Colors Everything
description: A quick win: understand The Halo Effect: One Trait Colors Everything.

hook.text: Attractive defendants get shorter sentences. Good-looking students get higher grades.

buildup.text: The halo effect: a positive impression in one area spills over into unrelated areas.

discovery.text: If a CEO is tall & articulate, we assume they're also smart & ethical.

twist.text: Apple's halo effect: loving the iPhone made customers rate the Mac as better â€” even before trying it.

climax.text: The reverse halo (horn effect) is equally powerful: one negative trait makes us see everything negatively.

punchline.text: Your brain judges the whole person from a single trait.

quiz.question: What is the halo effect?
options: A positive impression in one area biasing judgment in unrelated areas
